Body: Graphemics/graphetics is more of a sibling field to linguistics than a child. Their parent would be semiotics: spoken language represents ideas, written language represents spoken language (usually). So maybe graphemics/graphetics is more of a niece or nephew since it's dependent on the existence of spoken language...

OwnerUser.AboutMe: BA in Linguistics. Currently working as a localization & QA specialist at a translation company in Minneapolis. Studied: Latin, Spanish, French, Arabic, Polish, Mandarin. Conlanger. Sci fi & fantasy nerd, experimental cook, songwriter, artist and craftist. Also, I have a dog.
